name: qsv-extsort
description: Sort an arbitrarily large CSV/text file using a multithreaded external sort algorithm. This command has TWO modes of operation. * CSV MODE when --select is set, it sorts based on the given column/s. Requires an index. See `qsv select --help` for select syntax details. * LINE MODE when --select is NOT set, it sorts any input text file (not just CSVs) on a line-by-line basis. If sorting a non-CSV file, be sure to set --no-headers, otherwise, the first line will not be included in the external sort.

options.description: The field delimiter for reading CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)
When set, the first row will not be interpreted as headers and will be sorted with the rest of the rows. Otherwise, the first row will always appear as the header row in the output.
